Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Fundamentals of Filmmaking: A Digital Workshop  OART-UT.560 Stu 4 Credits Instructor(s): L. Fritz This practical workshop is designed to introduce students to the techniques and theory of developing and producing short film ideas that are shot on digital video and edited digitally on computer using Adobe Premiere Pro software. The course centers on learning elements of visual storytelling through a spectrum of aesthetic approaches. Working in crews of four, students learn directing, shooting, and editing skills as they each direct three short videos (three to five minutes in length).  Note: This course is specifically designed to fulfill the major requirements in production of students not majoring in film and therefore, students who need to fulfill this requirement are given registration priority. Students should add themselves to the waitlist for this class. Tisch Film/TV majors and freshmen may not enroll. Students will be asked to purchase an external hard drive. Students are required to purchase personal property insurance for this course. This course is also available for noncredit. Students interested in   taking this course as noncredit should register with course number   NCRD-UT 560.001. Check Albert for course schedule. Please visit the NYU Bursar's website for tuition and course fee details. NYU IT offers a variety of training options for the NYU community, including tutorials, in-person sessions, and occasional classes in the University's online training system, NYUiLearn.    See the links below for service-specific offerings, or explore NYU ServiceLink for self-guided support and training on a wide range of NYU IT services.     Advanced Media Studio consultations   Data Services tutorials: statistics, GIS mapping & more   Faculty Digital Archive   lynda.com   NYU Classes   NYU Google Apps for Education (including NYU Calendar, NYU Drive, NYU Email, NYU Groups, NYU Sites, and more)   NYU Lists   NYU Print Service   NYU Stream   NYU Survey Service (Qualtrics)   NYU Wikis   Telephones & voice mail   Web Publishing            There is no charge for any instructional sessions, but participants should bring a valid NYUCard to in-person classes and workshops.    Training by Request   NYU Information Technology   NYU IT may be able to arrange special training by request for NYU departments, classes, and organizations.      To request training in NYU-supported services not covered in the trainings and workshops listed above, send email to    AskITS@nyu.edu . Include your name,   NYU affiliation, desired topic of class, desired location, and the anticipated number of attendees. If training is available, an NYU IT representative will contact you to arrange a date and time that will be convenient for your group.    For special classes in statistics or mapping software, fill out the NYU Libraries'    Request an instruction session form or call Data Services at 1-212-998-3434.    For training in other software applications, contact the Digital Studio .      NYU Libraries   Bobst Library has subject specialists in many areas of study that support the University's curriculum. NYU faculty can make arrangements for advanced and subject-specific classes by filling out the NYU Libraries' Request an instruction session form. Advanced students needing in-depth reference assistance with primary sources, unpublished, archival and foreign materials, or doctoral research can  also make appointments with a subject specialist. For contact information, visit:   http://library.nyu.edu/research/lib_arc.html or fill out the   subject specialist contact form .    NYUiLearn IT Classes   Periodically, IT classes for NYU staff and faculty are available via NYUiLearn . To view class descriptions and register for sessions, when available:    Sign into NYUHome ( home.nyu.edu ) and go to the Work tab.  Click the NYUiLearn Login button within the NYUiLearn channel (may be towards the bottom of the page).  To see current IT class offerings, click Course Catalog and select Technology from the Category drop-down menu in the right corner.    Note : NYUiLearn is not currently available to NYU students; see the links above for other training resources.    Page last reviewed: October 17, 2014
